dt: {bc}to lead in a wrong direction or into a mistaken action or belief often by deliberate deceit

dt.t: His comments were a deliberate attempt to {wi}mislead{/wi} the public.

pt: {sc}deceive{/sc} {sc}mislead{/sc} {sc}delude{/sc} {sc}beguile{/sc} mean to lead astray or frustrate usually by underhandedness. {sc}deceive{/sc} implies imposing a false idea or belief that causes ignorance, bewilderment, or helplessness.

pt.t: tried to {it}deceive{/it} me about the cost

pt: {sc}mislead{/sc} implies a leading astray that may or may not be intentional.

pt.t: I was {it}misled{/it} by the confusing sign

pt: {sc}delude{/sc} implies deceiving so thoroughly as to obscure the truth.

pt.t: we were {it}deluded{/it} into thinking we were safe

pt: {sc}beguile{/sc} stresses the use of charm and persuasion in deceiving.

shortdef: to lead in a wrong direction or into a mistaken action or belief often by deliberate deceit
to lead astray : give a wrong impression
